trial_identification.studytitle: Mesenchymal Stromal Cells to Treat Steroid-refractory Graft Versus Host Disease after Bone Marrow Transplantation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A phase 1 study to assess the safety of mesenchymal stromal cells to treat steroid-refractory graft versus host disease after allogeneic haemopoietic stem cell tranplantation.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other inflammatory or immune system disorders

interventions.interventions: Mesenchymal stromal cells 2 X 10E6/kg administered intrvenously over 15 minutes weekly for two weeks

primaryOutcome.outcome: Safety assessed clinically and by blood tests weekly for 4 weeks, then monthly for 12 months after therapy
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months after therapy finished, as assessed weekly for 4 weeks after therapy finished, then monthly to 12 months

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Overall Survival as measured by actuarial survival from data linkage to medical records
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 12 months following completion of mesenchymal stromal cell therapy

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Age 18-60 Steroid-refractory graft versus host disease post allogeneic haemopoietic stem cell transplant Informed consent given

trial_design.concealment: Discussion of risks, benefits, explanation of patient information document. No allocation concealment, open label treatment
trial_design.designfeatures: Mesenchymal cells may be Human Leucocyte Antigen (HLA) identical, haploidentical or third party

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Royal Perth Hospital Wellington St Perth 6000 Western Auistralia

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Medical Research Foundation Royal Perth Hospital Wellington St Perth 6000 Western Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study hypothesis is that mesenchymal cells are safe and will be effective in treating steroid refractory graft versus host disease. Trial subjects will receive 2 X 10 E6/kg mesenchymal cells weekly for 2 weeks, are then reassessed weekly. If inadequate response may receive two further doses at weekly intervals. May be retreated if they subsequently relapse
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Mesenchymal Stromal Cells: A Transplant Tale. Australian Tissue Banking Forum May 2009, programme page 5.
